transcript: resolved to answer his father-in-law. Moreover, the words of the Masonic statutes, "be kindly and courte- ous," recurred to him. He blinked, went red, got up and sat down again, struggling with himself to do what was for him the most diffi- cult thing in lifeto say an unpleasant thing to a man's face, to say what the other, whoever he might be, did not expect. He was so used to submitting to Prince Vasili's tone of careless self-assurance that he felt he would be unable to withstand it no
